input_text:
Job Title: Principal Product Manager, Integrations Experience

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Overview

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work â€“ whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

The Teamwork Platform (TWP) team is is passionate about creating unique, sustainable customer value through experiences that differentiate and make Atlassian greater than the sum of its parts. We offer capabilities that enable teams to collaborate + work to stay in-sync and connected, across all the tools our customers love.

As a Principal Product Manager driving our Integration Experiences, you will help our customers get their best work done across all their tools - Atlassian and external apps. You will also make it easy for Admins to install, configure and maintain this toolset. We able to consider candidates who are based in Australia, New Zealand or the West Coast of the United States of America for this role.

Responsibilities

Use your Platform and Product expertise to independently deep dive into complex and ambiguous topics, uncover opportunities, and solve impactful problemsDefine big visions, weave market and customer needs into tight narratives, and work across Atlassian to execute successfullyInfluence, manage and work across the organization - from customers, to developers, and senior executives


Qualifications

7+ years of experience in product management Extensive Product Management experience building integrations for large-scale PlatformsIdeally with experience working in the B2B SAAS space serving Enterprise customersA track record for defining and executing complex Platform strategies at scale that create business and customer valueAbility to quantitatively and qualitatively understand complex problems, prioritize business and customer needsExcel in an environment where the topics and tasks are varied and you have to move quickly and learn fastA passion for raising the product craft bar and driving best practices throughout the company


Compensation

At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:

Zone A - 220,800 USD - 294,300 USD

Zone B - 198,700 USD - 264,900 USD

Zone C - 183,300 USD - 244,300 USD

Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones.

However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
